data.title: Toggle individual extensions on and off through Command Pallete and/or hotkey.

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Currently you can disable all extensions through the Command Pallete, and you can disable individual extensions using the side bar, but it would be nice to be able to quickly disable/enable and extension via the Command Pallete. And this would be for extensions you do want to use with the current project and/or file type, but not all the time.

My use case for this would be toggling vim key bindings on and off, but I'm sure there are more.

data.title: Two-finger pinch scrolls

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.10.2
- OS Version: macOS 10.12.3

Steps to Reproduce: 

1. Pinch in and out with two fingers on any long file.

Expected behavior: nothing happens.

Actual behavior: the screen scrolls up or down very quickly, faster than an actual two-finger swipe. This makes it way too easy to accidentally scroll far enough that you completely lose your place.

data.title: Objectlist / Table of Content
data.body:
Feature proposal
-----------------------

Today we have these 5 different tabs on the left where one can choose: Explorer, Search, Git, Debug and Extensions.

I would like to have a new one: Object Explorer / Table of Content
_(maybe some of you come with a better name)_

Some of the time you have to deal with big files and you can't split them. Two examples:
* a big C# class which you don't want to split into several files
* a big Latex book you are writing on

It would be nice to have a kind of "Content List" which helps you to jump from one part to the next.

For a C# file this would mean you browse throw the Object structure:

* Namespace
  * Class
    * Method 1
    * Method 2
    * Property 1

On a Latex file this would mean you browse throw the table of contents:

* chapter 1
   * section 1.1
   * section 1.2
* chapter 2
   * section 2.1
      * subsection 2.1.3

data.title: Make variables and callstack to reload asynchronously [feature request]
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.10.2
- OS Version: Ubuntu 14.04

When debugging with gdb doing step over takes a lot of time. Debugger is blocked until variables and call stack is reloaded.

data.title: TS go to definition should move the cursor to the symbol name, not select the entire definition
data.body: This was a recent change, I find the past behavior much more intuitive as it's easier to navigate within the symbol after jumping to the definition.

data.title: TS Go to implementation doesn't seem to work for multiple implementations
data.body:
I tried to ctrl+f12 to `IWorkspaceConfigurationService.lookup` and it did nothing https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/e92940c09c12d1a083e422125f0c96c6b55fbf68/src/vs/workbench/services/configuration/common/configuration.ts#L27

I expect a peek view like find all references only containing the implementations, alternatively in the meantime if that's difficult to do a popup saying there are multiple implementations would be good.

data.title: Explore extension host error spamming the core
data.body: Explore if the extension host can bring down the core using the API or through errors.

data.title: Adding "Run as Administrator" task to VS Codes task-bar option under Windows 10
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.10.2 (8076a19fdcab7e1fc1707952d652f0bb6c6db331, 2017-03-08T14:02:52.799Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.14393
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|vscode-yaml-validation|djabraham|0.0.1|
|githistory|donjayamanne|0.2.0|
|chocolatey-vscode|gep13|0.2.2|
|PowerShell|ms-vscode|0.10.1|
|Chef|Pendrica|0.6.2|
|Ruby|rebornix|0.10.4|
|vscode-icons|robertohuertasm|7.3.0|
|MDTools|seanmcbreen|1.0.0|
|code-settings-sync|Shan|2.5.1|
|code-spell-checker|streetsidesoftware|1.0.1|;


---

Steps to Reproduce:

1.  Install VS Code on Windows 10
2.  Pin Powershell to task bar
3.  Right click on newly pinned powershell app in task bar
4.  Should display "Run as Administrator" under "Tasks"
5.  Pin VS Code to task bar
6.  Right click on newly pinned VS Code app in task bar
7.  Only option is "New Window"
8.  Please add option of "Run as Administrator" to the tasks available under VS Code.

data.title: User settings editor doesn't update when config.update is called.
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.10.2 -- doesn't repro with the Insiders build (but I couldn't find a known bug on this), and it doesn't repro when a breakpoint is inserted in the onDidChangeConfiguration handler (which implies the bug is due to a thread race condition). 
- OS Version: Windows.

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Our unreleased extension code calls vscode.WorkspaceConfiguration.update in onDidConfigurationChange.

Bug: The settings file gets changed on disk but is not updated in the UI of the settings doc, which leads to a merge conflict as soon as another edit occurs in the out-dated settings editor.


When will this fix be available? Can you guys fast track a fix to the released branch? Or should we just release the next version of our extension to target 1.11.0?

data.title: editor.rulers rendering vertical ruler inconsistently with expectations

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.10.2 (8076a19fdcab7e1fc1707952d652f0bb6c6db331, 2017-03-08T14:02:52.799Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 6.1.7601
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|python|donjayamanne|0.6.0|
|EditorConfig|EditorConfig|0.6.2|
|tslint|eg2|0.8.1|
|vscode-docker|PeterJausovec|0.0.13|
|vscode-icons|robertohuertasm|7.3.0|:


---

I have the editor set to enable a vertical rule at the 140th character.

`"editor.rulers": [140]`

The expectation I have is that it shall always render the ruler.

I am not seeing the ruler show when I have a single file open (no split pane) and the side bar collapsed.
See the first image.

But I always see it with the side bar open. See image 2.

However, that behavior changes when splitting VS Code into two panes. The ruler only shows on the right pane.

This changes even further when reducing the ruler to 80 characters. All of the problems go away.
I thought at first it was being hidden behind the mini map, but when in full resolution (1920x1080) and having a single file. There is more than enough space to render the ruler as it renders just fine with the side bar open.

It has no problems rendering in a single pane or both panes with something smaller like 80. The problems seem to arise when having the ruler set to something larger like 140.

![no_ruler1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2420177/24051582/8670efa2-0b00-11e7-962f-529fb0004cb5.png)

![ruler1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2420177/24051557/6f273e3c-0b00-11e7-9f9d-e0e9f6f7cf27.png)

data.title: Keybindings UI - support action to revert to default binding
data.body:
We should support an action so that the user can revert back to the default for a key binding.

In the old UI I could revert to the default keybinding by simply deleting the text in the keybindings.json file

data.title: Add option to keep cursor relative to screen when scrolling with scrollPageUp/scrollPageDown commands

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
It would be great to have an option to keep the cursor relative to the page when scrolling up and down with the scrollPageUp and scrollPageDown (alt+pageUp/alt+pageDown) commands.

For example, with the option enabled and my cursor at the 3rd line on the screen when I press alt+pageDown I would expect both my screen and my cursor to have scrolled down 1 page in the document. The position of my cursor relative to my screen should have stayed the same (eg it should still be at the 3rd line counted from the top of the screen).

data.title: [i18n] Russian translation Issue
data.body:
In russian transaltion files
`i18n/rus/src/vs/workbench/parts/files/electron-browser/electronFileActions.i18n.json` and  `i18n/rus/src/vs/workbench/parts/files/electron-browser/fileActions.i18n.json`
following lines
```
"revealActiveFileInMac": "     ",
"revealInMac": "   ",
```
should be changed to 
```
"revealActiveFileInMac": "    Finder",
"revealInMac": "  Finder",
```

Reasons:
* uniformity with english `"Reveal in Finder"`
* `Finder` is application name and shouldn't be translated
* default file explorer can't be changed in macOS, so universality is unnecessary

data.title: [Feature Request] Should be able to move Debug controls to any other place on window
data.body: - VSCode Version: 1.10.2 - OS Version: Mac Sierra Steps to Reproduce: 1. Debug a node project, 2. Debug controls( Pause, Step Over, Step Into, Step out, Refresh, Stop) cannot be moved any other sides other than on top (of the tabs). Currently the controls overlap over all the open tabs, it is cumbersome to move the controls only horizonally(which ends up overlapping on another tab) every time we want to know the file which is open.

data.title: Could not resolve any model with uri ...

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.10.2 
- OS Version: OS X 10.12.3

Steps to Reproduce:

see also https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/16554

I'm writing an extension to preview a model (DSL) in an UML previewer window. Every time an exception happens (e.g. the user opens a text file which is not the expected DSL), the error above appears and then it seams that vs code cannot recover anymore. Even when everything should work correctly, the exception is raised and the extension seams not to work anymore correctly. Looks like an issue to me...

data.title: Correct disposal implementation for exception widget
data.body:
I believe the reason for the the exception is that _viewZone was disposed meanwhile it was scheduled to relayout. Added null check for _viewZone. Correct me if I am wrong.

Fixes #22607

data.title: Focus on next error/warning starts from beginning after editing a file
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.10.2
- OS Version: OS X 10.11.6

When I hit F8 to go through problems vscode always focuses on the first problem. This makes hard to fix multiple problems in file.

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Hit F8 several times and focus on problem
2. Hit Cmd+1 and focus editor area. Edit file and fix problem. (message about problem still exist, meaning that vscode is focused on current problem)
3. Hit F8 again to focus on next problem.
4. Notice that vscode focused the first problem again.

> Suggestion: F8 should search closest problem next to current position of cursor.
